action.primary: Nourishes and tonifies Liver and Kidney Yin

indications: Kidney and Liver Yin Deficiencies with dizziness, spots before the eyes, lower back soreness, premature graying of the hair and tinnitus
Yin Deficiency with Empty Fire Rising
Diminished visual acuity in those with Liver and Kidney Deficiency

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Yang Deficiency.
Contraindicated for those with diarrhea due to Spleen Deficiency Cold.
interactions: Use caution for those taking insulin, sulfonylureas and other antidiabetics such as tolbutamide (Orinase), glipizide (Glucotrol) and glyburide (DiaBeta/Micronase) as there may be a synergistic effect leading to hypoglycemia.

useCases: Dizziness, tinnitus, and blurred vision due to Liver and Kidney Yin Deficiencies.
Dizziness and weakness and soreness of the lower back and extremities due to Kidney Yin Deficiency.
Diminished visual acuity due to Liver and Kidney Yin Deficiency.
Strengthens the Yin to blacken the hair.
Dizziness. tinnitus, loose teeth and soreness and weakness of the low back and knees.
Hot flashes and steaming bone sensations.
Red and painful eyes due to Liver Yang Rising.

notes: This herb is an ancient Taoist longevity tonic.
It is common in treatments for immune Deficiency.
Some sources say that this herb releases the bowels and lubricates the Intestines.
This herb is used in treating various allergic and immune complex conditions.
It is used to treat tuberculosis of the Lungs or lymph in patients with signs of Yin Deficiency.

This herb is similar to Fr. Lycii #{GouQiZi} Gou Qi Zi and Fr. Mori #{SangShen} Sang Shen. Nu Zhen Zi nourishes Kidney and Liver Yin Deficiency only. Gou Qi Zi treats Yin and Yang Deficiencies and Sang Shen treats Liver and Kidney Yin and Blood Deficiencies.

Both Nu Zhen Zi and Hb. Ecliptae #{MoHanLian(Cao)} Mo Han Lian tonify Liver and Kidney Yin and treat symptoms of dizziness, tinnitus, vertigo premature graying of the hair and sore and weak low back and knees. Nu Zhen Zi also treats hot flashes and steaming bones from Deficiency Heat, while mo Han Lian more strongly cools the Blood to stop various kinds of bleeding.
